  • प्रधान मंत्री आवास योजना (PMAY) भारत सरकार की एक पहल है जिसमें शहरी गरीबों को 31 मार्च 2022 तक 2 करोड़ (20 मिलियन) किफायती घर बनाने के लक्ष्य के साथ किफायती आवास प्रदान किया जाएगा।
  • इसके दो घटक हैं: शहरी गरीबों के लिए प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना (शहरी) (PMAY-U) और ग्रामीण गरीबों के लिए प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना (ग्रामीण) ((PMAY-G और PMAY-R)।
  • घरों में शौचालय, सौभाग्य योजना बिजली कनेक्शन, उज्ज्वला योजना LPG कनेक्शन, पीने के पानी तक पहुंच और जन धन बैंकिंग सुविधाएं आदि सुनिश्चित करने के लिए इस योजना को अन्य योजनाओं के साथ जोड़ा गया है।

quiz.text:
The National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) has launched an agroecology-based programme JIVA. It will promote natural farming under its existing watershed and wadi programs in how many states?
राष्ट्रीय कृषि एवं ग्रामीण विकास बैंक (NABARD) ने कृषि-पारिस्थितिकी-आधारित कार्यक्रम JIVA शुरू किया है। यह कितने राज्यों में अपने मौजूदा वाटरशेड और वाडी कार्यक्रमों के तहत प्राकृतिक खेती को बढ़ावा देगा?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 11.

Key Points

  • The National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) has launched an agroecology-based program JIVA.
  • It will promote natural farming under its existing watershed and wadi programs in 11 states.
  • JIVA aims to ensure using the principles of agroecology and push the farming community toward natural farming as commercial farming cannot work in these regions.

Important Points

  • The new program named ‘JIVA’ was launched virtually on February 9, 2022.
  • Rs 50,000 per hectare will be invested under this program.
  • While the best practices will be implemented on 200 hectares in each project, these 200 hectares will be a learning platform for the whole village.


सही उत्तर 11 है।

Key Points

  • राष्ट्रीय कृषि एवं ग्रामीण विकास बैंक (NABARD) ने कृषि-पारिस्थितिकी-आधारित कार्यक्रम JIVA शुरू किया है।
  • यह 11 राज्यों में अपने मौजूदा वाटरशेड और वाडी कार्यक्रमों के तहत प्राकृतिक खेती को बढ़ावा देगा।
  • JIVA का उद्देश्य कृषि पारिस्थितिकी के सिद्धांतों का उपयोग सुनिश्चित करना और कृषक समुदाय को प्राकृतिक खेती की ओर ले जाना है क्योंकि इन क्षेत्रों में व्यावसायिक खेती काम नहीं कर सकती है।

Important Points

  • 'JIVA' नाम का नया कार्यक्रम वस्तुतः रूप से 9 फरवरी, 2022 को शुरू किया गया था।
  • इस कार्यक्रम के तहत 50,000 रुपये प्रति हेक्टेयर का निवेश किया जाएगा।
  • प्रत्येक परियोजना में 200 हेक्टेयर पर सर्वोत्तम प्रथाओं को लागू किया जाएगा, और ये 200 हेक्टेयर पूरे गांव के लिए एक सीखने और धर्मांतरण के मंच होंगे।

quiz.text:
The given question has three blanks, each blank indicating that something has been omitted. Choose the combination of words that would fit in the blanks correctly.

The narrative evolved by Pakistan is not only visionary but also an indispensable _________ which is ________ linked to peace and security in the region as well as attaining the goals of shared regional __________.

A. Force
B. Imperative
C. Inextricably
D. Capriciously
E. Prosperity
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is BCE, i.e., Imperative, Inextricably, Prosperity.
Key Points

Let's understand the meaning of these words:

  • Imperative: of vital importance; crucial
  • Inextricably: in a way that is impossible to disentangle or separate
  • Prosperity: the state of being prosperous

It should read as: 
The narrative evolved by Pakistan is not only visionary but also an indispensable imperative which is inextricably linked to peace and security in the region as well as attaining the goals of shared regional prosperity. 

 Important Points

There is a word 'indispensable' in the sentence which means absolutely necessary.

Additional Information

Let us understand the meaning of the other words:

  • Capriciously: in a way that changes suddenly and unexpectedly
  • Force: coercion or compulsion, especially with the use or threat of violence

quiz.text:
The given question has three blanks, each blank indicating that something has been omitted. Choose the combination of words that would fit in the blanks correctly.

The 'Middle Kingdom' evidently feels __________ to adopt such pressures after it has succeeded in _________ territories across its maritime borders, using _________ diplomatic, economic, and military pressures.

A. Debilitate
B. Emboldened
C. Annexing
D. Coactive
E. Coercive
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is BCE, i.e., Emboldened, Annexing, Coercive.
Key Points

Let's understand the meaning of these words:

  • Emboldened: given (someone) the courage or confidence to do something
  • Annexing: taking possession of an area of land or a country, usually by force or without permission
  • Coercive: using force to persuade people to do things that they are unwilling to do

It should read as: 
The 'Middle Kingdom' evidently feels emboldened to adopt such pressures after it has succeeded in annexing territories across its maritime borders, using coercive diplomatic, economic, and military pressures. 
Additional Information

Let us understand the meaning of the other words:

  • Debilitate: to make someone or something physically weak
  • Coactive: acting in concurrence or together

quiz.text:
The given question has three blanks, each blank indicating that something has been omitted. Choose the combination of words that would fit in the blanks correctly.

Her __________ expression and their _________ faces made it clear that the scheme had been __________ to the whole village.

A. Bemused
B. Elated
C. Perplexed
D. Accolade
E. Abstruse
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is ACE, i.e., Bemused, Perplexed, Abstruse.
Key Points

CAE might also have been a valid choice. Since, we don't have any option with that choice, we can't choose it. Thus, ACE would be the best fit option.

Let's understand the meaning of these words:

  • Bemused: marked by confusion or bewilderment
  • Perplexed: confused, because something is difficult to understand or solve
  • Abstruse: not known or understood by many people

It should read as: 
Her bemused expression and their perplexed faces made it clear that the scheme had been abstruse to the whole village. 
Additional Information

Let us understand the meaning of the other words:

  • Elated: extremely happy and excited, often because something has happened or been achieved
  • Accolade: an award or privilege granted as a special honour or as an acknowledgement of merit

quiz.text:
Direction: The following question consists of a sentence which is divided into three parts, with grammatical error in one or more than one part of the sentence. If there is an error in any part of the sentence, find the correct alternatives to replace those parts from the three options given below, to make the sentence grammatically correct. If there is an error in any part of the sentence and none of the alternatives is correct to replace that part, then choose 'None of the A, B, and C' as your answer. If the given sentence is grammatically correct or does not require any correction, choose 'No correction required' as your answer.

He worked to minimize the prospects of global disruption from this event (A) because ensured that the Russian federation was accepted as the successor state to the USSR, (B) including inheriting its permanent seat at the United Nations. (C)

(A) He worked to minimize the prospects of global disruption from this event
(B) and ensured that the Russian federation was accepted as the successor state to the USSR,
(C) including inheriting its permanent seat at the United Nations.
options: (D) None of the A, B, and C
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'B'.

Key Points

  • The error lies in the second part of the sentence.
  • In the second part of the sentence, the conjunction "because" is incorrect in the context of the sentence. It should be replaced with "and" to make the sentence meaningful.
  • The correct sentence is:
    • He worked to minimize the prospects of global disruption from this event and ensured that the Russian federation was accepted as the successor state to the USSR, including inheriting its permanent seat at the United Nations.
       

​​Additional Information

  • Let's look at the meaning of some difficult words:
    • ​Prospect: the possibility or likelihood of some future event occurring
    • Federation: a group of states with a central government but independence in internal affairs

quiz.text:
Direction: The following question consists of a sentence which is divided into three parts, with grammatical error in one or more than one part of the sentence. If there is an error in any part of the sentence, find the correct alternatives to replace those parts from the three options given below, to make the sentence grammatically correct. If there is an error in any part of the sentence and none of the alternatives is correct to replace that part, then choose 'None of the A, B, and C' as your answer. If the given sentence is grammatically correct or does not require any correction, choose 'No correction required' as your answer.

The Mundaraths showed great prudence and foresight, (A) including sending of two Mundarath women to some far-flung place in the hills (B) so that if the family was massacred by Tipu’s troops, the Mundarath bloodline would continue. (C)

(A) The Mundaraths shows great prudence and foresight,
(B) including sending off two Mundarath women to some far-flung place in the hills 
(C) so as if the family was massacred by Tipu’s troops, the Mundarath bloodline would continue.
options: (D) None of the A, B, and C
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is option (2) i.e. 'B'.

Key Points

  • The error lies in the second part of the sentence.
  • In the second part of the sentence the preposition "of" is incorrect in the context of the sentence. It should be replaced with "off" to make the sentence grammatically correct.
  • "of" is used for expressing the relationship between a part and a whole and "off" means "moving away and often down from".

The correct sentence is: "The Mundaraths showed great prudence and foresight, including sending off two Mundarath women to some far-flung place in the hills so that if the family was massacred by Tipu’s troops, the Mundarath bloodline would continue." 

​Additional Information

  • Let's look at the meaning of some difficult words:
    • Prudence: the quality of being prudent; cautiousness
    • Foresight: the ability to predict what will happen or be needed in the future
    • Massacre: an indiscriminate and brutal slaughter of many people

quiz.text:
Direction: The following question consists of a sentence which is divided into three parts, with grammatical error in one or more than one part of the sentence. If there is an error in any part of the sentence, find the correct alternatives to replace those parts from the three options given below, to make the sentence grammatically correct. If there is an error in any part of the sentence and none of the alternatives is correct to replace that part, then choose 'None of the A, B, and C' as your answer. If the given sentence is grammatically correct or does not require any correction, choose 'No correction required' as your answer.

It is one of the six forms of "pranama" in Hinduism and conveys that the person one is greeting, (A) even a stranger, shares a common atman with you, (B) so that “the divine in me bows (in greeting and recognition) the divine in you”.(C)

(A) It is one of the six forms of "pranama" in Hinduism and conveyed that the person one is greeting,
(B) even a stranger, shares a common atman to you,
(C) so that “to the divine in me bows (in greeting and recognition) to the divine in you”.
options: (D) None of the A, B, and C
quiz.solution:
The error lies in the third part of the sentence.

Key Points

  • The third part of the sentence is grammatically incorrect.
  • In the third part preposition "to" is missing before "the divine in you". To make the sentence error-free, it should be "to the divine in you".
  • The correct sentence is:
    • It is one of the six forms of "pranama" in Hinduism and conveys that the person one is greeting, even a stranger, shares a common atman with you, so that “ to the divine in me bows (in greeting and recognition) to the divine in you”.
       

​Additional Information

  • The preposition "to" is used for:
  • Expressing motion in the direction of (a particular location).
    • Example: She is going to school.
  • Expressing location, typically in relation to a specified point of reference
    • Example: Her office is forty miles to the south of the site.
  • ​Expressing a point reached at the end of a range or after a period of time
    • ​Example: There is a drop in profits from Rs.70 to Rs.20.

quiz.text:
Read the passage given below and answer the following questions.

The inspiration for the first two of these Agreements, signed in 1993 and 1996, came from the example set by first the Soviet Union and then Russia in concluding such understandings on CBMs with China. As the scholar Jingdong Yuan has noted, at the heart of the normalization of Russia-China relations was the resolution of the border dispute between the two and the development of CBMs in the border regions. Military confrontation — a defining feature in their relations from the 1960s (the bloody incident of 1969 on the Damansky island may be recalled) — was removed. A strategic partnership of equality and trust oriented towards the 21st century was developed.

After the coming to power of Mikhail Gorbachev, the Soviet Union_______a long-standing Chinese demand to allow the adoption of the median line of the navigational channel of the Amur-Ussuri River as the boundary between the two countries. It was a major concession and quite contrary to the conventional view that the bigger country is usually unwilling to cede ground in negotiations. Further Soviet moves to reduce China’s sense of insecurity followed. These were the removal of SS-20 intermediate-range ballistic missiles, including from along the border with China, and agreement to negotiate military CBMs. Moscow also made unilateral troop reductions.

In April 1990, an Agreement on the Guidelines of Mutual Reduction of Forces and Confidence-building in the Military Field in the Area of the Soviet-Chinese Border was signed. This committed the two governments to the reduction of military forces to the lowest level suited to normal good neighborly relations on “an equal basis for mutual security”. (The term “mutual and equal security” often used by our analysts and experts on India-China relations owes its currency to this reference in the 1990 Soviet-Chinese Agreement just referred to and what we learned from the Russians when they briefed us about their discussions on CBMs with the Chinese in the early 1990s). In May 1991, an Agreement on the Eastern Sector of National Boundaries was concluded by the two countries, resolving 98% of outstanding boundary issues. They also agreed that the zone of military CBMs would be 100 km on each side of the border.

The main characteristic of these CBMs was the willingness of the bigger power — the Soviet Union — to undertake unilateral concessions and asymmetric reductions in military strength vis-à-vis China. The collapse of the Soviet Union, far from hindering the process of normalization (A)/ only smoothened it further — Russia and China continued to improve (B)/ relations, their strategic convergence spurred at by shared suspicion about (C)/ the overwhelming preponderance of U.S. global power at the end of the Cold War. (D)

The success of their alignment post-1989 and the Deng Xiaoping-Gorbachev Summit (held against the backdrop of the Tiananmen Square student demonstrations) was that they identified common interests and were committed to building a relationship that was “broadly based and institutionalized” (Jingdong Yuan). What this signified is that military CBMs and tension-reduction along the border were ‘nested’ and fostered in a vast network of cooperative alignments. that Russia and China built up in numerous areas once they agreed to normalize their relations.

What was the heart of the normalization of Russia-China relations according to the passage?
options: (A) the resolution of the border dispute between the two and the development of CBMs in the border regions.
(B) a strategic partnership of equality and trust.
(C) the removal of SS-20 intermediate-range ballistic missiles, including from along the border with China, and agreement to negotiate military CBMs.
(D) the Guidelines of Mutual Reduction of Forces and Confidence-building in the Military Field in the Area of the Soviet-Chinese Border.
(E) the conventional view that the bigger country is usually unwilling to cede ground in negotiations.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is the resolution of the border dispute between the two and the development of CBMs in the border regions.

Key Points

  • In the second paragraph, it is clearly stated that the heart of the normalization of Russia-China relations was the resolution of the border dispute between the two and the development of CBMs in the border regions.

Hence, option 1 is the correct choice here.

What can be inferred from this line - "What this signified is that military CBMs and tension-reduction along the border were ‘nested’ and fostered in a vast network of cooperative alignments."
options: (A) the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the cooperative alignments is the changes and efforts that are made by Russia and China to mend their relationship.
(B) the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the military confrontation of 1960s.
(C) the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the protocol between the Government of the Republic of India and the Government of the People’s Republic of China on Modalities.
(D) the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the agreement on the Eastern Sector of National Boundaries.
(E) the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the measures to strengthen peace and tranquillity and confidence-building in the border areas.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the cooperative alignments is the changes and efforts that are made by Russia and China to mend their relationship.Key Points

  • From the above passage, we can conclude that how the Russia-China relationship went through different changes in the 20th century.
  • In the second paragraph, it is clearly stated that the Soviet Union granted the privilege to China of the adoption of the median line of the navigational channel of the Amur-Ussuri River as the boundary between the two countries, the removal of SS-20 intermediate-range ballistic missiles, and the agreement to negotiate military CBM.
  • In the third paragraph, it is stated that an Agreement on the Guidelines of Mutual Reduction of Forces and Confidence-building in the Military Field in the Area of the Soviet-Chinese Border was signed in April 1990, an Agreement on the Eastern Sector of National Boundaries was also concluded by the two countries in May 1991, and also, agreed that the zone of military CBMs would be 100 km on each side of the border.
  • From the above lines, it can be concluded that the reason for CBM's and military-reduction is the cooperative alignments is the changes and efforts that are made by Russia and China to mend their relationship, and the same can be inferred from the given line in the question, "What this signified is that military CBMs and tension-reduction along the border were ‘nested’ and fostered in a vast network of cooperative alignments."

Hence, option 1 is the correct choice here.

What is the antonym of the word preponderance given in the passage?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Inferiority.

Key Points

  • Let's look at the meanings of:
    • Preponderance: the fact or state of being above others in rank or importance.
      • Example: Rome, in its glory days, enjoyed overwhelming military preponderance.
      • Synonyms: dominance, eminence, noteworthiness
      • Antonyms: inferiority, mediocrity, obscureness
    • Inferiority: the state of not being good or not as good as someone or something else.
      • Example: His ill-treatment as a child had given him a strong sense of inferiority.
      • Synonyms: mundanity, normality, typicality
      • Antonyms: distinction, excellence, exquisiteness

Hence, it is clear that both words have different meanings, and Inferiority is the antonym of Preponderance.

Additional Information

  • Look at the meanings of the other words given in the options:
  • Word Meaning Example
    Haggle to talk over or dispute the terms of purchase. He had to haggle to get his friend to sell his guitar for 20 bucks.
    Scathing criticizing someone or something in a severe and unkind way. He was very scathing about the report, saying it was inaccurate.
    Vitriolic full of violent hate and anger.:
         		 He launched a vitriolic attack on the prime minister, accusing him of shielding corrupt friends.
    Sudsy covered in soap bubbles. Some jewelers provide their customers with sudsy ammonia cleaning kits.

What is the synonym of the word concession given in the passage?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Accommodation.

Key Points

  • Let's look at the meaning of:
    • Concession: something that is allowed or given up, often in order to end a disagreement.
      • Example: The union will seek further concessions before accepting the contract.
      • Synonyms: accommodation, compromise, negotiation
      • Antonyms: recantation, renouncement, repudiation
    • ​Accommodation: the act or practice of each side giving up something in order to reach an agreement.
      • ​Example: The twins each made an accommodation: Jane agreed to Joan's pink curtains, and Joan agreed to Jane's purple rug.
      • Synonyms: compromise, concession, give-and-take
      • Antonyms: disagreement, nonconformity, refusal​

Hence, it is clear that Accommodation is the synonym of Concession.

Additional Information

  • Look at the meanings of the other words given in the options:
  • Word Meaning Example
    Recantation to prepare by combining raw materials. I concocted a tropical fruit smoothie.
    Disavowal the denial of any responsibility or support for something; repudiation. The disavowal of his previous writings.
    Repudiation a refusal to confirm the truth of a statement. They were surprised by his sudden repudiation of all his former beliefs.
    Concoct to invent an excuse, explanation, or story in order to deceive someone He concocted a story about working late at the office.

What this signified is that military CBMs and tension-reduction along the border were ‘nested’ and fostered in a vast network of cooperative alignments. that Russia and China built up in numerous areas once they agreed to normalize their relations.

The given sentence may or may not contain an error in one of its parts. Identify the part containing the error. If the sentence is correct, select 'No error' as your answer.

The collapse of the Soviet Union, far from hindering the process of normalization (A)/ only smoothened it further — Russia and China continued to improve (B)/ relations, their strategic convergence spurred at by shared suspicion about (C)/ the overwhelming preponderance of U.S. global power at the end of the Cold War. (D)
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is C. 

Key Points

  • The error lies in the usage of the phrasal verb spurred at instead of spurred on. 
  • The usage phrase spur at is grammatically wrong.
  • Let's understand the meaning of this phrasal verb:
    • Spur on: To urge, encourage, or goad someone onward in some task or activity.
    • Example: Analysts think the president's recent actions have spurred on the economy.
  • ​Here, we have to use this phrasal verb as it implies that the relations of Russia and China were encouraged by shared suspicion about the overwhelming preponderance of U.S. global power at the end of the Cold War, and hence it contextually fits the sentence.

​Hence, the correct sentence is: The collapse of the Soviet Union, far from hindering the process of normalization only smoothened it further — Russia and China continued to improve relations, their strategic convergence spurred on by shared suspicion about the overwhelming preponderance of U.S. global power at the end of the Cold War.​

The success of their alignment post-1989 and the Deng Xiaoping-Gorbachev Summit (held against the backdrop of the Tiananmen Square student demonstrations) was that they identified common interests and were committed to building a relationship that was “broadly based and institutionalized” (Jingdong Yuan).
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is No correction required.

Key Points

  • In the given sentence, the phrase were committed to is used correctly.
  • The phrase were committed to is used in the sentence with the context of having promised to be involved in a plan of action.
  • Also, the given sentence is in the passive voice and past tense, and hence, were is correct helping verb to be used here as it refers to the plural pronoun they.

Hence, the correct sentence is: The success of their alignment post-1989 and the Deng Xiaoping-Gorbachev Summit (held against the backdrop of the Tiananmen Square student demonstrations) was that they identified common interests and were committed to building a relationship that was “broadly based and institutionalized” (Jingdong Yuan).

Additional Information 

  • Let's understand the meaning of the adjective committed:
    • placed in confinement (as in a mental institution).
      • Example: They are many committed patients in Streatham, London.
    • having made a pledge or commitment to someone (such as a romantic partner) or something (such as a cause). 
      • Example: I am in a committed relationship.
    • having promised to be involved in a plan of action
      • Example: We are committed to withdrawing our troops by the end of the year.

It was a major concession and quite contrary to the conventional view that the bigger country is usually unwilling to cede ground in negotiations. Further Soviet moves to reduce China’s sense of insecurity followed. These were the removal of SS-20 intermediate-range ballistic missiles, including from along the border with China, and agreement to negotiate military CBMs. Moscow also made unilateral troop reductions.

In April 1990, an Agreement on the Guidelines of Mutual Reduction of Forces and Confidence-building in the Military Field in the Area of the Soviet-Chinese Border was signed. This committed the two governments to the reduction of military forces to the lowest level suited to normal good neighborly relations on “an equal basis for mutual security”. (The term “mutual and equal security” often used by our analysts and experts on India-China relations owes its currency to this reference in the 1990 Soviet-Chinese Agreement just referred to and what we learned from the Russians when they briefed us about their discussions on CBMs with the Chinese in the early 1990s). In May 1991, an Agreement on the Eastern Sector of National Boundaries was concluded by the two countries, resolving 98% of outstanding boundary issues. They also agreed that the zone of military CBMs would be 100 km on each side of the border.

The main characteristic of these CBMs was the willingness of the bigger power — the Soviet Union — to undertake unilateral concessions and asymmetric reductions in military strength vis-à-vis China. The collapse of the Soviet Union, far from hindering the process of normalization (A)/ only smoothened it further — Russia and China continued to improve (B)/ relations, their strategic convergence spurred at by shared suspicion about (C)/ the overwhelming preponderance of U.S. global power at the end of the Cold War. (D)

The success of their alignment post-1989 and the Deng Xiaoping-Gorbachev Summit (held against the backdrop of the Tiananmen Square student demonstrations) was that they identified common interests and were committed to building a relationship that was “broadly based and institutionalized” (Jingdong Yuan). What this signified is that military CBMs and tension-reduction along the border were ‘nested’ and fostered in a vast network of cooperative alignments. that Russia and China built up in numerous areas once they agreed to normalize their relations.

Fill in the blank with the most appropriate word given in the option.

After the coming to power of Mikhail Gorbachev, the Soviet Union_______a long-standing Chinese demand to allow the adoption of the median line of the navigational channel of the Amur-Ussuri River as the boundary between the two countries.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is conceded.

Key Points

  • In the given sentence, the correct verb to be filled in the blank is conceded.
  • Let's look at the meaning of concede:
    • to admit that something is true although you do not want to.
      • Example: When it was clear that he would lose the election, he conceded defeat.
    • to allow somebody to take something although you do not want to.
      • Example: They lost the war and had to concede territory to their enemy.
  • ​Here, in the given sentence, the usage of conceded implies that the Soviet Union allowed China the adoption of the median line of the navigational channel.
  • Other words don't fit the blank contextually.

​​Hence, the complete sentence is: After the coming to power of Mikhail Gorbachev, the Soviet Union conceded a long-standing Chinese demand to allow the adoption of the median line of the navigational channel of the Amur-Ussuri River as the boundary between the two countries.

​Additional Information

  • Let's look at the meanings of the words given in the other options:
  • Phrasal Verb Meaning Example
    concurred

    (past participle of concur)

    to agree or have the same opinion. 

    		 The new report concurs with previous findings.
    compelled

    (past participle of compel)

    having to do something because you are forced to or feel it is necessary.

    		 He felt compelled to report the incident.
    conduced

    (past participle of conduce)

    to help make a particular situation happen or help produce a particular result.

    		 The belief that technological progress conduces to human happiness.

quiz.text:
Direction: The given sentence contains a blank. Identify the phrase/statement that can make the given sentence grammatically and contextually correct. 

India is not the only major country convulsed by the Covid-19 pandemic ________ specialized critical care drugs.
options: (A) which is looking to end one-country dependence for medicines, both generic and
(B) that has been looking to end one-country's dependent for medicines, both generic and
(C) that is looking to end one-country dependence for medicines, both generic or
(D) that is looking to end one-countrys dependence for medicines, both generic and
(E) that is looking to end one-country dependence for medicines, both generic and
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'that is looking to end one-country dependence for medicines, both generic and'. 

Key Points

  • Whenever we use 'only, the same, etc.' we use the relative pronoun 'that'.
  • When nouns are used as adjectives (one-country), they are not used with apostrophes or in plural forms. 
  • 'both' is always followed by 'and'. 
  • All the given rules are satisfied only in option 5. 
  • Therefore, option 5 is the correct answer. 


Complete Sentence: India is not the only major country convulsed by the Covid-19 pandemic that is looking to end one-country dependence for medicines, both generic and specialized critical care drugs.

quiz.text:
Directions: In a question given below an incomplete sentence that must be filled/completed with one of the sentences/phrases given below i.e. one of the sentences/phrases can be fit into the given blanks. Choose the correct option and complete the given sentences.

Along with a massive investment program, ___________________________ contracts management in the bargain.
options: (A) we need to objectively improved procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strengthen
(B) we need to objective improve procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strengthen
(C) we need objectively to improves procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strengthen
(D) we need objectively improve procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strength
(E) we objectively need to improve procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strengthen
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'we objectively need to improve procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strengthen'

Key Points

  • Let's see the grammatical structure of the sentence-
    • ​In the sentence after the comma, the subject is 'we' and the main verb is 'need' and we know that when we have the main verb 'need' it takes the preposition 'to' and also, after the preposition 'to' we cannot use an adverb because this makes the split infinitive case that is generally incorrect in grammar.
    • 'Objectively' is an adverb and the placement of adverb in the sentence is always in-between the auxiliary verb and the main verb. Hence, the adverb, in this case, will be placed before 'need'
    • 'improve' here is the infinitive verb also, 'and' is a conjunction that follows the parallelism rule hence after the verb we need to use a verb if it is joined with the conjunction 'and' so the correct verb is 'strengthen'

So the correct sentence is→ Along with a massive investment program, we objectively need to improve procurement processes for big-ticket investments in the pipeline, and strengthen contracts management in the bargain.

quiz.text:
Direction: The given sentence contains a blank. Identify the phrase/statement that can make the given sentence grammatically and contextually correct. 

Financial inclusion is generally presumed as an endeavour that provides people, ________.
options: (A) particularly for whom in formerly unbanked areas, a bank account.
(B) a bank account is especially important for persons who have previously unbanked.
(C) especially those in the hitherto unbanked region, a bank account.
(D) a bank account, particularly for persons who is previously been unbanked.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'especially those in the hitherto unbanked region, a bank account.'

Key Points

  • The given sentence is talking about financial inclusion that provides people with bank accounts, particularly to those who don't have access to the services of a bank.
  • Option 1 gets eliminated as the use of 'whom' is wrong. 'Whom' is used for the objective case. 
  • Option 2 gets eliminated as it should be in the passive voice and 'have been' should be used. 
  • Option 4 gets eliminated as the use of the singular verb 'is' with 'persons' is wrong. 
  • From the given explanation, we can understand that option 3 fits correctly in the given sentence. 
  • Therefore, option 3 is the correct answer. 


Complete Sentence: Financial inclusion is generally presumed as an endeavour that provides people, especially those in the hitherto unbanked region, a bank account.​
Additional Information

  • Let's learn some important words from the given sentence: 
    • endeavour: earnest, prolonged, and industrious effort.
    • presumed: suppose that something is the case on the basis of probability.
    • hitherto: until now or until the point in time under discussion.
    • unbanked: not having access to the services of a bank or similar financial organization.

quiz.text:
Directions: Seven sentences are given, in which the last sentence is fixed; also one sentence is going to be filled with the appropriate word. Arrange the sentences to form a meaningful paragraph. Out of the seven sentences, there is one sentence that does not fit into the theme of the passage thus formed. Read the sentences carefully and answer the questions that follow.

A. Though a few suspected patients were treated in the makeshift isolation ward of Teku Hospital, no new cases were reported until the last week of March.

B. The second case was confirmed on 23 March in a young woman who had recently flown to Kathmandu from France via Qatar.

C. The first COVID-19 case in Nepal was confirmed on 23 January in a 32-year-old man who had returned from China on 9 January.

D.  Schools, universities, and colleges have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 63 countries, affecting approximately 47 percent of the world's student population.

E. In the third week of March, Nepal began to see a significant influx of people from India as India saw an increase in new cases throughout the country.

F. The patient had shown mild symptoms and was confirmed _______ when he tested negative on 29 and 31 January.

G. A nationwide lockdown was implemented on 24 March.

Which of the following should be the THIRD sentence after rearrangement?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'A.'

Key Points

  • The correct sequence or order of the segments after rearrangement is CFAEBG.
    • The sentence 'C' is independent of any other sentence as it introduces the topic of ''The first COVID-19 case in Nepal''. Hence, 'C' is the first sentence.
    • Sentence F will come after C as it is talking about the condition of the first COVID-19 patient in Nepal.
    • Sentence A will come after F as it is saying that a few suspected patients were treated in the Teku Hospital in Nepal and no new cases were reported until the last week of March.
    • Sentence E will come after A as it is giving information about what happened in the last week of March i.e. Nepal began to see a significant influx of people from India due to an increase in new cases there.
    • Sentence B will come after E as it is talking about the confirmation of the second case in a young woman who had flown to Kathmandu from France via Qatar.
    • The sentence 'G' is the final or sixth sentence as it is concluding that due to the rise in COVID-19 cases in Nepal, a nationwide lockdown was implemented on 24 March.


Hence, the correct answer is option 5.

Paragraph after rearranging the sentences: The first COVID-19 case in Nepal was confirmed on 23 January in a 32-year-old man who had returned from China on 9 January. The patient had shown mild symptoms and was confirmed recovered when he tested negative on 29 and 31 January. Though a few suspected patients were treated in the makeshift isolation ward of Teku Hospital, no new cases were reported until the last week of March. In the third week of March, Nepal began to see a significant influx of people from India as India saw an increase in new cases throughout the country. The second case was confirmed on 23 March in a young woman who had recently flown to Kathmandu from France via Qatar. A nationwide lockdown was implemented on 24 March.

quiz.text:
Directions: Seven sentences are given, in which the last sentence is fixed; also one sentence is going to be filled with the appropriate word. Arrange the sentences to form a meaningful paragraph. Out of the seven sentences, there is one sentence that does not fit into the theme of the passage thus formed. Read the sentences carefully and answer the questions that follow.

A. Though a few suspected patients were treated in the makeshift isolation ward of Teku Hospital, no new cases were reported until the last week of March.

B. The second case was confirmed on 23 March in a young woman who had recently flown to Kathmandu from France via Qatar.

C. The first COVID-19 case in Nepal was confirmed on 23 January in a 32-year-old man who had returned from China on 9 January.

D.  Schools, universities, and colleges have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 63 countries, affecting approximately 47 percent of the world's student population.

E. In the third week of March, Nepal began to see a significant influx of people from India as India saw an increase in new cases throughout the country.

F. The patient had shown mild symptoms and was confirmed _______ when he tested negative on 29 and 31 January.

G. A nationwide lockdown was implemented on 24 March.

Find the appropriate word to fill in the blank.

The patient had shown mild symptoms and was confirmed _______ when he tested negative on 29 and 31 January.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Recovered.'

Key Points

  • The given sentence is talking about a patient, who showed mild symptoms of COVID-19 and returned to a normal state of health when he tested negative on 29 and 31 January.
  • Therefore, the most appropriate word to be filled in the blank is 'Recovered'.
  • Also, the use of the word ''negative'' in the sentence indicates the use of the word 'recovered' in the blank.
  • The word 'Recovered' means To return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
    • Example: The patient recovered quickly.
       

Hence, the correct answer is option 3.

Complete Sentence: The patient had shown mild symptoms and was confirmed recovered when he tested negative on 29 and 31 January.

Additional Information

  • Let us explore  the other options:
    • Regressed means To return to a former or less developed state.
    • Relapsed means To become worse again after an improvement.
    • Ailed means To trouble or afflict someone in mind or body.
    • Withered means To cause to decline or deteriorate; weaken.

quiz.text:
From the options given below, select the option which states the correct combination of incorrect/correct sentences.

A. On the first day, the bowlers pitched the ball up in search of movement that was not there and did not adjust their length enough quickly.
B. Healthy hares can easily outrun foxes, but rarely can escape relentless packs of hounds chasing them for up to 90 minutes.
C. The high court yesterday here ordered the Eastern Cape Welfare Department to pay two years' back pay with interest to a permanently disabled Quigney resident.
D. Once stranded, large whales are crushed by their own body weight, if they cannot quickly return to the water.
options: (C) A, B and C are incorrect
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Option 3) i.e. A, B, and C are incorrect

Explanation-

  • Part A) 'quickly enough' should be there in place of 'enough quickly'
  • Explanation: 'Enough' can be used both as an adjective and as an adverb. Since the given sentence enough is used as an adverb, it will be used after the word it is qualifying while when used as an adjective it should be placed before the word it is qualifying.
     
  • Part B) 'can rarely escape' should be there in place of 'rarely can escape' 
  • Explanation: Adverb of frequency is used after the auxiliary verb and before the main verb
     
  • Part C) 'here yesterday' should be there in place of 'yesterday here'
  • Explanation: Adverb of manner, place and time comes together then they are used in the sequence as mentioned (Manner, place and time)
  • Part D) 'Quickly' is correctly used here.
     

Correct Sentence A: 'On the first day, the bowlers pitched the ball up in search of movement that was not there and did not adjust their length quickly enough.'
Correct Sentence B: 'Healthy hares can easily outrun foxes, but can rarely escape relentless packs of hounds chasing them for up to 90 minutes.'
Correct Sentence C: 'The high court here yesterday ordered the Eastern Cape Welfare Department to pay two years' back pay with interest to a permanently disabled Quigney resident.'

quiz.text:
From the options given below, select the option which states the correct combination of incorrect sentences.

A. The widespread use of Latin was, seldom or never antagonistic to the preservation of national sentiment.
B. The Ohio Company founded Marietta at the mouth of the Muskingum in 1788, and this is regarded the oldest permanent settlement in the state.
C. There are some things enough important that you're forced to tell someone, regardless of what might happen to you.
D. Princess Mary experienced a painful rather than a joyful feeling.
options: (A) Both A and B are incorrect
(B) A, B and D are incorrect
(C) Both B and C are incorrect
(D) Both A and D are incorrect
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Both B and C are incorrect.
Key Points

  • A) The widespread use of Latin was, seldom or never antagonistic to the preservation of national sentiment.
  • 'Seldom or never', 'seldom if never', 'little or nothing' and 'little if anything' are correct but it is wrong to say 'seldom or ever' or 'little or anything'.
  • B) The Ohio Company founded Marietta at the mouth of the Muskingum in 1788, and this is regarded the oldest permanent settlement in the state.
  • 'regarded as' should be there in place of 'regarded'
  • The adverb 'as' can be used with - Regard, describe, define, treat, view, know.
  • Example: 
    • ​Chemistry has been defined as the study of chemicals.
  • C) There are some things enough important that you're forced to tell someone, regardless of what might happen to you.
  • 'important enough' should be there in place of 'enough important'.
  • If 'enough' is used as an adverb, it is used after an adjective which it modifies.
  • Example: 
    • ​He is faster enough to defeat you.
  • D) Princess Mary experienced a painful rather than a joyful feeling.
  • When the sentence is in negative notion, we use 'rather'.

Correct Sentence B: 'The Ohio Company founded Marietta at the mouth of the Muskingum in 1788, and this is regarded as the oldest permanent settlement in the state.'
Correct Sentence C: 'There are some things important enough that you're forced to tell someone, regardless of what might happen to you.'

quiz.text:
Read the given passage carefully and answer the following question

World over half to two-thirds of all businesses are Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs). This turnover (1) is much higher. The benefits of SMEs have created a special status and importance in the Five-Year Plans right from its inception. SMEs must keep in view that employees are as important as customers and suppliers. Since the number of employees is less so, each and every employee in SMEs is very important. And when potential (2) is very high, SMEs face a problem to continue. SMEs know each and every employee because of fewer numbers. So, their challenges of talent management can be handled on an individual basis. There is greater involvement of top management because the founder in most of the cases was singly responsible for HR activities. SMEs need to be more formulation (3) by adopting the best talent management practices because without empowering HR, no business can run. 50% of the employees can never have come through employees' references or internal job postings and screening methods used for acquisition are also very less. HR managers must be responsible not only for ends but also for means. Attracting and retaining talented SMEs is very tough due to fewer opportunities. The image of small size is the biggest hurdle to attracting talent. Since the motivation is not directly tied to employees' pay packages, several offer options must be there to attract and retain employees. SMEs don’t involve their employees in strategy proportion (4) and in decision-making. So this is a demotivating point for the employees (SMEs are also less concerned about succession planning). There must be effective delegation and decentralization of decision-making power and authority to boost the talent of the employees. Co-ownership needs to be encouraged to leverage the talent of the people by making the right balance of power between employees and employers.
 
SMEs are pivotal to economic development. Since a large number of the workforce is employed in SMEs they have to manage talent management strategies. This is the only key to success in meeting the challenges of the globalization scenario. SMEs face resource constraints, especially new technology solutions. So, by proper talent management practice, they can easily survive in the competitive environment problem of a good talent pool for SMEs. This is the challenge that arises because of the fact that big companies use a variety of talent acquisition practices but in SMEs, the employees are acquired by the owner or manager himself. Another problem is that the HR department for SMEs is usually not more than one person who wears many hats. SMEs can’t afford in-depth talent management practices because of the fewer economies of scale. This is the biggest challenge for SMEs. SMEs don’t hire an active database of competitive (5) hires. They place advertisements when a new vacancy arises without considering past databases. SMEs don’t offer standard rewards & their compensation system is not well designed. A lack of career planning strategies makes hurdles in the pathway of talented employees. SMEs generally provide fewer training & developmental opportunities.

What is the biggest hurdle to attract talent in SMEs?
options: (A) SMEs don’t involve their employees in strategy formulation and in decision-making.
(B) The image of small size of a SME
(C) Absence of effective delegation and decentralization of decision-making power and authority
(D) Lack of the right balance of power between employees and employers.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is The image of small size of a SME

Key Points 

  • Let's refer to the 6th line in the first paragraph of the passage:
    • "Attracting and retaining talented SMEs is very tough due to fewer opportunities. The image of small size is the biggest hurdle to attracting talent."
  • Hence talented employees are not attracted to SMEs due to their image as small-size enterprises.
     

Therefore, the correct answer is option 2).

quiz.text:
Read the given passage carefully and answer the following question

World over half to two-thirds of all businesses are Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs). This turnover (1) is much higher. The benefits of SMEs have created a special status and importance in the Five-Year Plans right from its inception. SMEs must keep in view that employees are as important as customers and suppliers. Since the number of employees is less so, each and every employee in SMEs is very important. And when potential (2) is very high, SMEs face a problem to continue. SMEs know each and every employee because of fewer numbers. So, their challenges of talent management can be handled on an individual basis. There is greater involvement of top management because the founder in most of the cases was singly responsible for HR activities. SMEs need to be more formulation (3) by adopting the best talent management practices because without empowering HR, no business can run. 50% of the employees can never have come through employees' references or internal job postings and screening methods used for acquisition are also very less. HR managers must be responsible not only for ends but also for means. Attracting and retaining talented SMEs is very tough due to fewer opportunities. The image of small size is the biggest hurdle to attracting talent. Since the motivation is not directly tied to employees' pay packages, several offer options must be there to attract and retain employees. SMEs don’t involve their employees in strategy proportion (4) and in decision-making. So this is a demotivating point for the employees (SMEs are also less concerned about succession planning). There must be effective delegation and decentralization of decision-making power and authority to boost the talent of the employees. Co-ownership needs to be encouraged to leverage the talent of the people by making the right balance of power between employees and employers.
 
SMEs are pivotal to economic development. Since a large number of the workforce is employed in SMEs they have to manage talent management strategies. This is the only key to success in meeting the challenges of the globalization scenario. SMEs face resource constraints, especially new technology solutions. So, by proper talent management practice, they can easily survive in the competitive environment problem of a good talent pool for SMEs. This is the challenge that arises because of the fact that big companies use a variety of talent acquisition practices but in SMEs, the employees are acquired by the owner or manager himself. Another problem is that the HR department for SMEs is usually not more than one person who wears many hats. SMEs can’t afford in-depth talent management practices because of the fewer economies of scale. This is the biggest challenge for SMEs. SMEs don’t hire an active database of competitive (5) hires. They place advertisements when a new vacancy arises without considering past databases. SMEs don’t offer standard rewards & their compensation system is not well designed. A lack of career planning strategies makes hurdles in the pathway of talented employees. SMEs generally provide fewer training & developmental opportunities.

Why can't SMEs afford in-depth talent management practices?
options: (A) SMEs don’t hire an active database of potential hires
(B) HR department for SMEs is usually not more than one person who wears many hats.
(C) SMEs have fewer economies of scale.
(D) The employees are acquired by the owner or manager himself.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is SMEs have fewer economies of scale.

Key Points 

  • Let's refer to the 4th line of the second paragraph of the passage:
    • "SMEs can’t afford in-depth talent management practices because of the fewer economies of scale. This is the biggest challenge for SMEs."
  • Hence due to the lack of an economic budget SMEs are unable to afford in-depth talent management practices.
     

Therefore, the correct answer is option 3).

Additional Information 

  • Comprehension questions can be answered quickly by:
    • Reading the passage carefully.
    • Identifying the purpose of the passage.
    • Going through the questions correctly and comprehending the correct meaning.

What is the antonym of the word acquisition?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Dearth 

Key Points

  • Acquisition generally means 'the act of acquiring something (कुछ हासिल करने की क्रिया)'
    • Ex: This sculpture is the museum’s latest acquisition.
    • Synonyms: Accession, accomplishment, accretion, possession, etc.
    • Antonyms: Lack, dearth, loss, etc.
  • The marked word Dearth means 'an inadequate supply; lack of something (किसी चीज की कमी)'
    • ​Ex: There's a real dearth in knowledge about how to manage money.
  • Hence, Acquisition and Dearth are opposite in meaning.
     

Therefore, the correct answer is option 3)

quiz.text:
Read the passage given below and answer the question that follows.

During the Romantic era, Shakespeare was praised by the poet and literary philosopher Samuel Taylor Coleridge, and the critic August Wilhelm Schlegel translated his plays in the spirit of German Romanticism. In the 19th century, critical admiration for Shakespeare's genius often bordered on adulation. "This King Shakespeare," the essayist Thomas Carlyle wrote in 1840, "does not he shine, in crowned sovereignty, over us all, as the noblest, gentlest, yet strongest of rallying signs; indestructible". The Victorians produced his plays as lavish spectacles on a grand scale. The playwright and critic George Bernard Shaw mocked the cult of Shakespeare worship as "bardolatry", claiming that the new naturalism of Ibsen's plays had made Shakespeare obsolete.

What is the tone of the passage?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Analytical.

Key Points

The passage talks about how Shakespeare has both been praised as well as criticized. The passage provides an unbiased look at Shakespeare's validity as one of the masters of English Literature.  Thus, the correct tone of the passage is 'Analytical'.

Additional Information

  • Cynical: believing that people are motivated purely by self-interest; distrustful of human sincerity or integrity
  • Descriptive: serving or seeking to describe
  • Lampooning: publicly criticize (someone or something) by using ridicule, irony, or sarcasm
  • Sombre: dark or dull in colour or tone

quiz.text:
A paragraph is given with one word highlighted. Find the correct phrase from the following options that should keep the meaning of the word intact without introducing any grammatical error in the sentence.

It is important to be friendly with others because you will be working and dealing with other people all of your life. If you can be kind to others, you are more likely to be successful in whatever you do. Being understanding shows sensitivity and respect, and makes it more likely that other people will behave the same way. In other words, treat others the way you want to be treated.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Get along'.

Key Points

  • The phrase 'get along' means to have a harmonious or friendly relationship.
  • So ‘friendly’ can be replaced with ‘get along’ without introducing any grammatical or contextual error in the sentence. 
  • The phrase mentioned in option (1), 'go along' means continue or progress.
  • The phrase mentioned in option (2), 'be along' means arrive.
  • Options (4) and (5) are grammatically incorrect.

Hence, the correct option is option 4.​

Additional Information

  •  A phrasal verb is an idiomatic phrase consisting of a verb and another element, typically either an adverb, as in break down, or a preposition, for example, see to, or a combination of both, such as look down on.

quiz.text:
Directions: In the following question, two sentences are given with some underlined phrases which are correct. Phrases of sentence II could replace phrases of sentence I without altering the original meaning of the sentence. Select the option that has the correct pair/s of phrase replacement.

I. The king has generously (A) agreed to donate (B) all the proceeds to charity. (C)

II. He has munificently (D) awarded those who helped him (E)win battles.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A-DKey Points

  • The phrase 'The king has generously' from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase 'He has munificently' from sentence II.
  • ​Generously means In a generous manner, munificently.
    • "He gave munificently/generously to several charities"
  • Therefore, these two phrases can be interchanged.
  • Correct sentence: 
    • Sentence I: He has munificently agreed to donate all the proceeds to charity.
    • Sentence II: The king has generously awarded those who helped him win battles.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

quiz.text:
Directions: In the following question, two sentences are given with some underlined phrases which are correct. Phrases of sentence II could replace phrases of sentence I without altering the original meaning of the sentence. Select the option that has the correct pair/s of phrase replacement.

I. At the beginning (A) of his speech, Finn found it necessary to touch on (B) the circumstances of the event(C)

II. At the commencing (D) of the movie, it is important to mention (E) the star cast and special guest (F).
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A-D, B-E

Key Points

  • The phrase 'At the beginning' from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase 'At the commencing 'from sentence II.
    • Commencing means Taking the first step, beginning 
  • Also, the phrase necessary to touch on from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase important to mention from sentence II.
    • As the meaning of to touch on is mention
  • Therefore, these two phrases can be interchanged.
  • Correct sentence: 
    • Sentence I: At the commencing of his speech, Finn found it important to mention the circumstances of the event.
    • Sentence II: At the beginning of the movie,  it is necessary to touch on the star cast and special guest.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 2.

quiz.text:
Directions: In the following question, two sentences are given with some underlined phrases which are correct. Phrases of sentence II could replace phrases of sentence I without altering the original meaning of the sentence. Select the option that has the correct pair/s of phrase replacement.

I. The question is, should a citizen (A) be able to count on (B) its government to preserve free access (C) to clean water?

II. For my own part (D), I should not like to think that I ever rely on (E) you for the right(F) to study.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is B-E, C-FKey Points

  • The phrase count on from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase rely on from sentence II.
    • Count on: Judge to be probable, rely on
  • Also, the phrase free access from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase the rightfrom sentence II.
  • ​Therefore, these two phrases can be interchanged. 
  • Correct sentence: 
    • Sentence I: The question is, should a citizen be able to rely on its government to preserve the right to clean water.
       
    • Sentence II: For my own part, I should not like to think that I ever count on you for free access to study.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 4.

quiz.text:
Directions: In the following question, two sentences are given with some underlined phrases which are correct. Phrases of sentence II could replace phrases of the sentence I without altering the original meaning of the sentence. Select the option that has the correct pair/s of phrase replacement.

I. Religious bigots look down upon(A) anyone who does not conform to(B) their beliefs. (C)

II. Drivers may despise(E) the person with a speed camera, but McNickle said he needs to follow(F) the rules.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A-E, B-F.

Key Points

  • The phrase Look down upon from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase/word despise from sentence II.
  • It means to regard with contempt.
  • Therefore these two phrases can be interchanged.
  • Also, the phrase/word conform to from the sentence I can be replaced with the phrase/word follow from sentence II.
  • It means to adapt or conform oneself to new or different conditions.
  • Therefore, these two phrases can be interchanged.
  • Correct sentence: 
    • Sentence I: Religious bigots despise anyone who does not follow their beliefs.
    • Sentence II: Drivers may look down upon the person with a speed camera, but McNickle said he needs to conform to the rules.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 3.
